column3:
Even if it was negative, we'd get an huge unsigned value which is greater than `vout.size()`.

 utACK 77f63a4

Nit: should we phase out C-style casts? In this case it's obviously just a `static_cast`, but I think it would be safer to use new-style casts in all new code. I wrote a PR for the developer docs: #8177\n

> Nit: should we phase out C-style casts? In this case it's obviously just a static_cast, but I think it would be safer to use new-style casts in all new code. I wrote a PR for the developer docs: #8177\n\nI've never seen an argument that made c++ style casts safer for this kind of usage. It's much shorter to write C-style casts if you just want to, say, convert a signed integer to an unsigned one
